title: Searching For Supernovae
content:
Use the arrow buttons to blink through the images. When you find the supernova, click on its location in the image.

You can determine the type of supernova by overlaying supernovae light curve templates. Try this out by clicking on the “Type Ia” button at the right.

Drag the Type Ia light curve template to try to match it to the data points on your graph.

Now click on the Type IIp button, and drag this template to match the data of your graph.
